subject: Re: How do I extend the TestSuite

messageBody:
Hello,

I worked it out. You need to define a static method:
public static TestSuite suite() {
return new MyTestSuite();
}
in the test case. It is not enough to just extend TestSuite, as many
of the tools do not use the extended TestSuite but instantiate their
own.

Cheers


--- In junit@y..., Jason Rogers <jacaetev@y...> wrote:
> I may be missing your point, but why not just extend TestSuite and
override the
> addTest() method?
>
> -jason
>
> --- gavinlas <gavinlas@h...> wrote:
> > Hello,
> >
> > I would like to have control over the test cases and tests that
are
> > added to a TestSuite.
> >
> > I could extend the TestSuite or I could manually add test cases.
> > However, I would like to use my new test suite with the existing
> > JUnit tools (like SwingRunner, textRunner, etc). These tools seem
to
> > instantiate a TestSuite.
> >
> > Any idea how I can fit my new test suite class into this
architecture.
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> >
